::DeathScythe::

DeathScythe laughs. "But you did bring me in, fool," DeathScythe 
says, walking up to Zyber and lowering his gun at her head, "And this 
is how you get repayed..."

An idea occurs to DeathScythe, the assassin putting away his gun and 
laughing. "But very well," he says, "You saved my life, so I shall 
let you live."

With that, he kicks her, turning around and walking off. He figured 
that the damage she had recieved would kill her anyways, but slowly 
and with more agony than a gunshot.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> * Zyber simply kept her optics on DeathScythe.*
> 
> " Pureness of spark counts for everything, and does more then you 
know. If I 
> was mean and bitter I WOULD have killed you where you layed, but I 
did not. 
> I took you in and repaied you...only to be threatened with death. 
But I have 
> pure of spark, and I am not weak. I simply chose not to battle."
> 
> * Zyber almost didn't see it as DeathScyth fired at her again, 
sending her 
> over towards the opening and slamming against a sharp corner.
> She didn't cry out in pain when the rock dug into her back, but she 
didn't 
> rise again, she couldn't.
> She hung her head a bit.*
> 
> " But you have no...right to speak. You are weak too...or you would 
not 
> have...been laying there in the forst in stasis lock!"
